intro: Lampranthus borealis, commonly known as the Southern Cross. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known as the ice plant family, and is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils. It has a succulent habit, with fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid conditions. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal gardens.
